meanings.definition: To invest with a scepter or emblem of authority.
meanings.sent1: The king sceptring his son as the new prince.
meanings.sent2: She sceptring the mayor with the key to the city.
meanings.sent3: The magician sceptring the rabbit with a tiny crown.
meanings.sent4: The teacher sceptring the student with the responsibility of leading the class.
meanings.sent5: The coach sceptring the captain with the team's flag before the game.

meanings.definition: To wield a scepter as a symbol of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The queen sceptring her scepter during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: He sceptring the staff meeting with his golden scepter.
meanings.sent3: The child sceptring a toy scepter while playing make-believe.
meanings.sent4: The CEO sceptring the boardroom with her presence and authority.
meanings.sent5: The wizard sceptring the enchanted forest with his magical scepter.
